testcase.name: Dimension Member Filter Processing - Variables without a member
testcase.description: Test dimension member filter processing. In each case, a member is to be sourced from a variable, but the variable did not evaluate to an item fact with a reported member for the relevant dimesion.

variation.name: Member variable evaluates to fallback value
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member evaluates to a fallback value, meaning that the member is ignored.

variation.name: Member variable name is a parameter
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member is a parameter, meaning that the member is ignored.

variation.name: Member variable name is a general variable
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member is a general variable, meaning that the member is ignored.

variation.name: Member variable binds to sequence with consistent dimension values
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member binds to a sequence of facts, but they all have the same value for the dimension, so this is used as the member value.

variation.name: Member variable binds to sequence with inconsistent dimension values
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member binds to a sequence of facts, and they do not all have the same value for the dimension, so an error is raised.

variation.name: Member variable binds to tuple
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member binds to a tuple fact, so the member is ignored.

variation.name: Member variable binds to fact with no value for dimension
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member binds to a fact with no reported or default value for the dimension, so the member is ignored.

variation.name: Member variable binds to fact with default value for dimension
variation.description: The variable used for the first filter member binds to a fact with a default value (though none lexically reported) for the dimension, so the member is used. This is the same formula linkbase as V-06, but with a different taxonomy (which specifies a default member for the region dimension).

variation.name: All members faulty behaves as though none were specified
variation.description: The variations above demonstrate that some faulty filter members do not prevent non-faulty ones being used. This variation demonstrates that if all specified filter members are faulty (do not produce filter-member values), the filter behaves as though it has no members specified, i.e. matches any fact with a value reported for the dimension.
